Feature Description: Removes standing administrator privileges from end users, enforcing least privilege by default
Elevates approved applications automatically without user interaction or prompts
Allows users to request elevation themselves with business justification, without IT ticket
Elevation requests routed to helpdesk or admin for manual approval via console
Captures and stores user-provided reason for why elevation is needed
One-time codes generated by admin and provided to user for temporary elevation
Routes elevation requests to user's manager for approval before granting access
Requires multiple approvers (e.g., manager then security) before elevation granted
Emergency override mechanism for urgent access when normal approval unavailable
Approvers can approve/deny requests via mobile app without console access
Automatically escalates unanswered requests to backup approver after timeout
Configurable time limit for how long elevated privileges remain active
Automatically removes elevated privileges when session timer expires
Restricts when elevation can be requested (e.g., business hours only)
Users can extend active session without going through full approval again
Only explicitly approved applications can run; all others blocked by default
Specific applications explicitly blocked from running regardless of user
Unknown applications run in restricted sandbox with limited system access
Isolates untrusted content/applications in secure container to prevent system damage
Policies applied based on Active Directory user accounts or security groups
Policies applied based on device name, OU, or device group membership
Different elevation rules for different applications based on risk profile
Policies vary based on user location, IP address, or network zone
Dynamic policies that adjust based on real-time risk score of user/device
Complete log of all elevation requests, approvals, denials, and actions taken
Records who approved each elevation request for accountability
Sends elevation events to Security Information and Event Management platform
Pre-built reports for SOX, PCI, HIPAA and other compliance frameworks
Video-like recording of all actions performed during elevated session
Agent support for Windows 10 and Windows 11 workstations
Agent support for Windows Server editions (2016, 2019, 2022)
Agent support for Apple macOS endpoints
Agent support for Linux distributions (RHEL, Ubuntu, etc.) with sudo management
Built-in integration with ServiceNow or other ITSM for ticket creation
Native integration with Intune, Entra ID, Defender, and other Microsoft tools
Integration with Privileged Access Management vault for credential checkout

Advanced controls to detect and block ransomware execution patterns
